description: Equipment purchase for the CCG vessels 1200 and 1100
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Contract Information

*  **Contract Title:** F7049-230255: Equipment Purchase for Canadian Coast Guard Vessels
*  **Reference Number:** WS4456570487-Doc4456723270
*  **Amendment Number:** 10
*  **Solicitation Number:** WS4456570487

## Contract Timeline

*  **Publication Date:** March 14, 2024
*  **Tender Closing Date:** May 3, 2024 (2:00 PM EDT)
*  **Amendment Date:** May 1, 2024
*  **Expected Contract Start Date:** April 22, 2024
*  **Expected Contract End Date:** November 1, 2027

## Contract Details

*  **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
*  **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
*  **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
*  **Trade Agreements:** Admissibility to multiple international trade agreements

## Contract Requirements

*  **Regions of Delivery:** Quebec (excluding National Capital Region)
*  **End-User Entities:** Canadian Coast Guard (CCG)
*  **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*  **Contact Information:** Ioana Novac (SPAC/PSPC) at ioana.novac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

## Additional Information

*  **Notice URL:** [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19096854](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19096854?extsite=MTkwOTY4NTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)
*  **Description of Contract:** Purchase of various equipment for the 1200 and 1100 Canadian Coast Guard vessels.
*  **Contract Status:** Expiré (Expired) // If you want to utilize an alternative wording there are more. 
This is my minimal interpretation of the text. Feel free to add any additional details or amend it, if you see fit. 400-word is quite limiting, though. [As one alternative, I used Expiré - while it makes sense with what little I understand, the text doesn't indicate that the there ever was a closing date. Otherwise it would actually have the meaning of "Has reached the closing date for tenders." ]   
Please let me know how
